hero.title: The AI Crossroads
hero.subtitle: Connect, create, and extend your AI capabilities with a unified platform. Build and manage plugins that enhance your AI workflows.

pluginManagement.title: Plugin Management
pluginManagement.description: Browse, configure, and manage MCP servers and plugins
pluginManagement.content: Connect various AI tools and services through a unified interface. Configure and manage your plugins from a central dashboard.

aiPlayground.title: AI Playground
aiPlayground.description: Test and experiment with your AI tools in an interactive environment
aiPlayground.content: Experience your plugins in action. The playground allows you to test different configurations and see real-time results.

customDevelopment.title: Custom Development
customDevelopment.description: Create and customize your own MCP servers and tools
customDevelopment.content: Build custom capabilities using our Python editor and integrated development environment. Extend your AI with specialized functionalities.

gettingStarted.title: New to Plugged.in?
gettingStarted.description: Follow our setup guide to get your environment configured properly and start building with Plugged.in right away.

mcpServers.title: MCP Servers
mcpServers.subtitle: Plugin Management
mcpServers.description: Configure and manage your MCP servers. Connect to external tools and services through command-line or URL-based interfaces.

actions.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this MCP server?

form.addDescription: Create a new MCP server configuration. Choose between STDIO (command-based) or SSE (URL-based) server type.
form.name: Name
form.descriptionPlaceholder: (Optional) Brief description of the server's purpose
form.envVarsHelp: Enter environment variables in KEY=value format, one per line
form.serverUrlHelp: Must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS URL

import.title: Import MCP Servers
import.description: Import multiple MCP server configurations from JSON. This will add new servers without replacing existing ones.

error.importFailed: Failed to import servers. Please check the console for details.

export.title: Export MCP Servers Configuration
export.description: Your MCP server configurations in JSON format, ready to import on another instance.

empty.title: No Servers Found
empty.noServers: You haven't added any MCP servers yet

search.subtitle: Search across all content

search.noMatchingFilters: No results match the selected filters

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.description: Your API keys are used to authenticate requests to the Plugged.in API. Keep them secure and do not share them with others.
apiKeys.empty: No API keys yet. Create one to get started.

create.title: Create API Key
create.description: Create a new API key for your project. You can optionally give it a name to help identify its purpose.

delete.title: Delete API Key
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this API key{{name}}? This action cannot be undone.

copied.title: API Key copied
copied.description: The API key has been copied to your clipboard.

created.title: API Key created
created.description: Your new API key has been created successfully.

deleted.title: API Key deleted
deleted.description: Your API key has been deleted successfully.

legal.title: Legal
legal.subtitle: Important Documents
legal.description: Important documents and legal information for Plugged.in

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: How we collect, use, and protect your data

content.intro: Welcome to Plugged.in ("we," "our," or "us"). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our service. Please read this privacy policy carefully.
content.disclaimer: If you do not agree with the terms of this privacy policy, please do not access the service.
content.note: IMPORTANT NOTE: Plugged.in is currently in Release Candidate status. This privacy policy may be updated as the service matures and additional features are implemented.
content.thirdParty: We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third-party sites or services.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: Terms and conditions for using our service

content.intro: By accessing or using Plugged.in, you agree to these Terms and any additional terms that may apply. If you do not agree to these Terms, you must not access or use Plugged.in.

responsibilities.title: Your Responsibilities
items: Use MCP servers and tools in compliance with applicable laws and regulations
Not use MCP servers for any illegal or unauthorized purpose
Take responsibility for MCP servers you configure or deploy

content.title: Disclaimer and Limitation of Liability
content.thirdParty: The service may contain links to third-party websites or services that are not owned or controlled by us. We have no control over, and assume no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party websites or services.

content.title: Contact Information
content.description: For any questions about these legal documents, please contact us

account.title: Delete Account
account.description: Permanently delete your account and all associated data
account.confirmDescription: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete your account and remove all associated data from our servers.

proxyBenefits.title: Benefits of Plugged.in MCP
proxyBenefits.description: Plugged.in MCP acts as a unified proxy for all your MCP servers, providing several advantages:
benefits: Single Configuration Point - Manage all your MCP servers through one central configuration
Automatic Updates - Get the latest features and security updates automatically
Simplified Authentication - Use a single API key for all your MCP servers
Enhanced Security - Built-in security features and best practices
Cross-Platform Compatibility - Works seamlessly across different operating systems

installation.title: Installation Methods
installation.apiKeysNotice: Notice: you can manage your API Keys in the API Keys Page

cursorConfig.title: Cursor Configuration
cursorConfig.description: For Cursor, you can configure Plugged.in MCP directly in the settings:
steps: Open Cursor and go to Cursor Settings
Find 'MCP Servers' and click 'Add new MCP Server'
